thread.title: Beyonce proves she is still queen at the 2017 Grammy Awards and social media can't deal
thread.title_full: Beyonce proves she is still queen at the 2017 Grammy Awards and social media can't deal

author: Heather Leighton, Houston Chronicle
title: Beyonce proves she is still queen at the 2017 Grammy Awards and social media can't deal
text:
Photo: Twitter Image 16 of 17 Beyonce performs onstage during The 59th GRAMMY Awards and her fans on social media could not deal. Beyonce performs onstage during The 59th GRAMMY Awards and her fans on social media could not deal. Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images For NARAS Image 17 of 17 Beyonce proves she is still queen at the 2017 Grammy Awards and social media can't deal 1 / 17 
Beyonce's talent never fails her fans. 
Especially when the superstar is pregnant with twins. 
The Houston native performed her "Lemonade" hits "Love Drought" and "Sandcastles" at the 59th Grammy Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday and needless to say, the 35-year-old looked like goddess queen. 
UNKNOWN FASHION: Singer you likely don't know wears "Trump" dress to Grammys 
As she performed, with her unborn twins likely jamming inside her, her fans could not deal with her beauty, grace, talent, and performing abilities. 
LOS ANGELES (AP) — There are few things Beyonce has not conquered, and the Grammy for album of the year is one of them. For the third time, Beyonce is nominated for the coveted trophy, an award given to few R&B-based performers and only two hip-hop acts in the Grammy's 59-year history. She was nominated for the top prize in 2010 with "I Am ... Sasha Fierce" (losing to Taylor Swift) and in 2015 with "Beyonce" (Beck was the surprise winner). Media: WochIt Media 
"How are we supposed to continue after this? HOW?!" publication Refinery29 tweeted . "We are unworthy," another user added. To see the other reactions to Beyonce's epic Grammys performance, click through the gallery above and her performance in the video below. WATCH: Beyoncé's Full Grammy Performance of Love Drought & Sandcastles. #GRAMMYs  pic.twitter.com/KMzDzcAv2b — BEYONCÉ VAULT (@BeyonceVault) February 13, 2017 
But the most iconic and heart-melting reaction to the performance was when Beyonce blew a kiss to 5-year-old daughter Blue Ivy in the audience. Naturally, even her daughter swooned over the shout-out with an encouraging applaud. Blue Ivy Carter's reaction to her mom's performance is the CUTEST. #Grammys pic.twitter.com/VXiqszl4vl
